subject: Re: [junit] Writing a test for a PrintStream and for a log rotation method
msgSnippet: Great tip Joe, thanks!  Just one question about it, my printstream variable is a global private static one. Therefore, once it s set in the log rotation method
messageBody:
Great tip Joe, thanks! Just one question about it, my
printstream variable is a global private static one.
Therefore, once it's set in the log rotation method it gets
used in the other methods. If I were to pass it in as a
parameter what changes should I make to make sure the same
reference is maintained?

--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:

> Asif Sattar wrote:
> > Hi everyone,
> >
> > Two questions:
> >
> > 1. I'm trying to write a test for a method that does
> not
> > return anything. It creates a printstream for writing
> to a
> > log file. I've included the code below. How do I go
> about
> > writing a test for this?
>
> Change the method so that it doesn't /create/ a
> PrintStream, but rather
> accepts one as a parameter. This way you can substitute
> it in your tests.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com
> Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer
> Testing
>


Asif
